verbs.description: Along with most Americans , I [V: do] n't buy into President Trump 's " fake news " protests . However , neither do I buy into some of the media 's incomplete news reporting . A case in point is the question as to whether Trump 's attorney , Michael Cohen , known as " The Fixer , " will flip on Trump . When I first heard this on broadcast news , I got the impression that there must be some basis for Cohen to flip that concerned Trump . Alas , that impression was short - lived after reading about Trump 's tweet that " Most people will flip if the Government lets them out of trouble , " even if " it means lying or making up stories . " Ultimately , there may be a reason for Cohen to flip . However , until such a reason is known , the media must objectively report the news ( aka the facts ) in context so that the public may make its own evaluation . Otherwise , label the report as an opinion , which the public may or may not believe . Keith Swensen , Southwest Portland

However , until such a reason is known , the media must objectively report the news ( aka the facts ) in context so that the public may make its own evaluation . Along with most Americans , I do n't buy into President Trump 's " fake news " protests . However , neither do I buy into some of the media 's incomplete news reporting . A case in point is the question as to whether Trump 's attorney , Michael Cohen , known as " The Fixer , " will flip on Trump . When I first heard this on broadcast news , I got the impression that there must be some basis for Cohen to flip that concerned Trump . Alas , that impression was short - lived after reading about Trump 's tweet that " Most people will flip if the Government lets them out of trouble , " even if " it means lying or making up stories . " Ultimately , there may be a reason for Cohen to flip . However , until such a reason is known , the media must objectively report the news ( aka the facts ) in context so that the public may make its own evaluation . Otherwise , label the report as [ARG1: an opinion] , [R-ARG1: which] [ARG0: the public] [ARGM-MOD: may] or [ARGM-MOD: may] [ARGM-NEG: not] [V: believe] . Keith Swensen , Southwest Portland
